document_metadata.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Pharmacological inhibition or downregulation of HDAC6 in cellular and animal models increases acetylated tubulin abundance (6,8–13).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: The Akt-dependent glycogen synthase kinase-3β (GSK-3β) increases the deacetylase activity of HDAC6 on tubulin as shown in hippocampal neurons (Figure 2)(12).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Moreover, inhibition or knockdown of HDAC6 in cultured neurons increases the axonal transport of mitochondria by increasing acetylated tubulin amounts and the concomitant recruitment of motor protein dynein and kinesin-1 to microtubules (10,12).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Overexpression of HDAC6 induces depolymerization and subsequent deacetylation, indicating that tubulin dimers and monomers are deacetylated, while acetylation only occurs in polymerized microtubules (8).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Genetic ablation of HDAC6 leads to hyperacetylation of microtubules and HSP90 without any obvious abnormal effects on development and survival of these mice (33).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: In vitro models of HD demonstrated that HDAC6 inhibition restores acetylated tubulin abundance and subsequently the axonal transport defects observed in diseased states (10).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Recently, it has been found that Tau is deacetylated mainly by sirtuin-1, a class III HDAC, and to a lesser extent by sirtuin-2 and HDAC6 (17).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Moreover, inhibition or knockdown of HDAC6 in cultured neurons increases the axonal transport of mitochondria by increasing acetylated tubulin amounts and the concomitant recruitment of motor protein dynein and kinesin-1 to microtubules (10,12).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Moreover, inhibition or knockdown of HDAC6 in cultured neurons increases the axonal transport of mitochondria by increasing acetylated tubulin amounts and the concomitant recruitment of motor protein dynein and kinesin-1 to microtubules (10,12).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Overexpression of HDAC6 induces depolymerization and subsequent deacetylation, indicating that tubulin dimers and monomers are deacetylated, while acetylation only occurs in polymerized microtubules (8).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Overexpression of HDAC6 induces depolymerization and subsequent deacetylation, indicating that tubulin dimers and monomers are deacetylated, while acetylation only occurs in polymerized microtubules (8).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Overexpression of HDAC6 induces depolymerization and subsequent deacetylation, indicating that tubulin dimers and monomers are deacetylated, while acetylation only occurs in polymerized microtubules (8).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Moreover, inhibition or downregulation of HDAC6 results in reduced axonal length and decreased growth and shrinkage velocity of microtubules (9,11).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Moreover, inhibition or downregulation of HDAC6 results in reduced axonal length and decreased growth and shrinkage velocity of microtubules (9,11).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Inhibition of HDAC6 deacetylase activity with a consequent accumulation of acetylated PRX could lead to a beneficial increase in antioxidant activity (21).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: In HDAC6-deficient regulatory T cells, HSF1-regulated genes including HSP90 were upregulated (25,26).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: HDAC6 senses the presence of ubiquitinated aggregates and consequently induces the expression of major cellular chaperones by triggering the dissociation of a repressive HDAC6/HSF1/HSP90 complex and subsequent HSF1 activation (27).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: HDAC6 senses the presence of ubiquitinated aggregates and consequently induces the expression of major cellular chaperones by triggering the dissociation of a repressive HDAC6/HSF1/HSP90 complex and subsequent HSF1 activation (27).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Inhibition of HDAC6 also induces a reduction in binding of HSP90 to vascular endothelial growth factor receptor 1 and 2 (VEGFR1/Flt1 and VEGFR2/Flk1, respectively), followed by increased binding of HSP70 to these receptors (28).

effect.name: vascular endothelial growth factor receptor 1 binding

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Knockdown of HDAC6 leads to a depletion of VEGFR1/Flt1 and VEGFR2/Flk1 (28).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Knockdown of HDAC6 leads to a depletion of VEGFR1/Flt1 and VEGFR2/Flk1 (28).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Genetic ablation of HDAC6 leads to hyperacetylation of microtubules and HSP90 without any obvious abnormal effects on development and survival of these mice (33).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Genetic ablation of HDAC6 leads to hyperacetylation of microtubules and HSP90 without any obvious abnormal effects on development and survival of these mice (33).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Treatment with an HDAC inhibitor also delays disease progression and increases survival in a mouse model of ALS, further supporting the notion that HDAC6 is a central enzyme in the disease (58).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Genetic ablation of HDAC6 leads to hyperacetylation of microtubules and HSP90 without any obvious abnormal effects on development and survival of these mice (33).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Another strain of HDAC6 knockout mice demonstrate ubiquitin-positive aggregates and apoptotic cell death, both pathogenic hallmarks of neurodegeneration, in the brain from 6 months of age on (34).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Another strain of HDAC6 knockout mice demonstrate ubiquitin-positive aggregates and apoptotic cell death, both pathogenic hallmarks of neurodegeneration, in the brain from 6 months of age on (34).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Conversely, HDAC6 deficiency leads to failure of autophagosome maturation, protein aggregate build-up and neurodegeneration (34).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Finally, HDAC6 overexpression is able to rescue the phenotype of a Drosophila model of spinobulbar muscular atrophy, indicating that HDAC6 might partially counteract the pathogenesis of neurodegenerative disorders characterized by an impaired UPS (36).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: VCP/p97 promotes ubiquitin chain turnover and protein degradation through the UPS, whereas HDAC6 favors the accumulation of ubiquitinated proteins and subsequent perinuclear aggregation (27,40,41).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Pharmacological inhibition and ablation of HDAC6 interferes with the recruitment of Atg-8/LC3 to the aggresome (Figure 3) (37).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: HDAC6 also stimulates autophagosome–lysosome fusion by promoting F-actin remodeling in a cortactin-dependent manner (Figure 3) (34).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Finally, HDAC6 overexpression is able to rescue the phenotype of a Drosophila model of spinobulbar muscular atrophy, indicating that HDAC6 might partially counteract the pathogenesis of neurodegenerative disorders characterized by an impaired UPS (36).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: HDAC6 thus might be a promising therapeutic target for ciliopathies that give rise to a wide variety of symptoms such as multiorgan failure with variable central nervous system involvement (46–48).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Inhibition of the proteasome system in cellular models potentiates the interaction between HDAC6 and Tau, and facilitates perinuclear aggregation of Tau independently of the deacetylase activity (15).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: HDAC6 deficiency blocks the formation of aggregates and interferes with autophagy (49).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: In a Drosophila model for PD, depletion of HDAC6 significantly increases the loss of dopaminergic neurons, retinal degeneration and locomotor dysfunction (52).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: In a Drosophila model for PD, depletion of HDAC6 significantly increases the loss of dopaminergic neurons, retinal degeneration and locomotor dysfunction (52).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: In a Drosophila model for PD, depletion of HDAC6 significantly increases the loss of dopaminergic neurons, retinal degeneration and locomotor dysfunction (52).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Conversely, overexpression of HDAC6 promotes inclusion formation and suppresses the α-synuclein-induced loss of neurons and retinal degeneration (52).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: In vitro models of HD demonstrated that HDAC6 inhibition restores acetylated tubulin abundance and subsequently the axonal transport defects observed in diseased states (10).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: Moreover, rapid muscle denervation due to axonal loss and defects in axonal transport is observed in cellular and animal models of ALS in which HDAC6 also might play a role (18,59).

citation.name: HDAC6 at the Intersection of Neuroprotection and Neurodegeneration.

links.evidence: HDAC6 deficiency in HD mice also does not influence the disease progression at the behavioral level (53).
